keywords: Make it Fast Cook it Slow
name: Cook the Book: Moroccan Lentil Soup
description: "What really struck me about cooking with the slow cooker—how easy it was." [Photograph: Stephanie O'Dea] When Stephanie O'Dea set out to make this Moroccan Lentil Soup during her yearlong slow-cooking project she had quite a bit of experience using...
recipeIngredient: 1 (15-ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed
1 (15-ounce) can pinto beans, drained and rinsed
1 (28-ounce) can of diced tomatoes and their juices
1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated

recipeInstructions.text: Use a 6-quart slow cooker. Chop the vegetables and add to the stoneware. If you are rushed in the morning, consider chopping the vegetables the night before-it took me longer than I wanted it to.

Drain and rinse the beans and add to the mix. Add the dried lentils. Add the ginger, garlic, and spices. Stir in the vegetable broth and the entire can of tomatoes. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
